
A hasty admin encrypted a secret message using RSA, but accidentally chose Blum integers for both primes. Recover the flag from the ciphertext: 10230432997896364359702918797390392175874365651434693394292497506898378152083064008017605953609009639145603560447332615152512504071116510982686977751508408


The flag format is flag{...}
n=12367661635372792512769043230395732708584705255724692422927705351449865743659750904223524076222586660978201567590901333499095273011081764978477316250839309, e=2139484753358496744011558227373366244384036653368515190152907104772256486013850727781538100745543975200786298511028385464566258395229728906795665838173589
The lower 104 bits of p are: 80514903273492067600512084858597114583


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{vaxlsknl}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 10230432997896364359702918797390392175874365651434693394292497506898378152083064008017605953609009639145603560447332615152512504071116510982686977751508408
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=12367661635372792512769043230395732708584705255724692422927705351449865743659750904223524076222586660978201567590901333499095273011081764978477316250839309, e=2139484753358496744011558227373366244384036653368515190152907104772256486013850727781538100745543975200786298511028385464566258395229728906795665838173589
The lower 104 bits of p are: 80514903273492067600512084858597114583

extra_info: p=109385383220273614474091449942093094381905789001661257803183683802351008318167, q=113065030000101107512922342673770117895939867381887431182099134229774639946427, Ï†(n)=12367661635372792512769043230395732708584705255724692422927705351449865743659528453810303701500599647185585704378623487842711724322096482160445190602574716
